<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Helper method to get file length of the record</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// including newline character</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a5cc90f8ab69486d41b44a9586daf2830"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a5cc90f8ab69486d41b44a9586daf2830">getLength</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b9d675b34f20ba67f1f3213e63935d6">DataSize</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// :LLAAAATT&#91;DD...DD&#93;CC&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b9d675b34f20ba67f1f3213e63935d6">DataSize</a> &#42; 2 + 11;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Gets length of line in a file (getLength + CRLF).</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Given type, address and data returns line which can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be written to output file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/objcopy/elf/#a089ec210aac08118be0717834c18d24a">IHexLineData</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a219548daa98092da7c5c31fc6e029f07">getLine</a>(uint8&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a>, uint16&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a130762ad48651cb8468de1f43798bcef">Addr</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa20539e89704d20b98b97e9c3feac934">Data</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Parses the line and returns record if possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Line should be trimmed from whitespace characters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;IHexRecord&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a5af15c8c6dcb6f71dff853ebdbae3ef4">parse</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Line);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Calculates checksum of stringified record representation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// S must NOT contain leading &#39;:&#39; and trailing whitespace</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// characters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint8&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a36361ab61c92cc509c46bcc75b8dd34a">getChecksum</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> S);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35">Type</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Contains data and a 16-bit starting address for the data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The byte count specifies number of data bytes in the record.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a9a50f8bf29974951a166212a08837edb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a9a50f8bf29974951a166212a08837edb">Data</a> = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Must occur exactly once per file in the last line of the file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The data field is empty (thus byte count is 00) and the address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// field is typically 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a8e2df6a62da76caf0639c33b2441dbfd"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a8e2df6a62da76caf0639c33b2441dbfd">EndOfFile</a> = 1,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The data field contains a 16-bit segment base address (thus byte</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// count is always 02) compatible with 80x86 real mode addressing.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The address field (typically 0000) is ignored. The segment address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// from the most recent 2 record is multiplied by 16 and added to each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// subsequent data record address to form the physical starting address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for the data. This allows addressing up to one megabyte of address</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// space.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35aa23fe5b66dcc6cf788ccc5fc8339a208"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35aa23fe5b66dcc6cf788ccc5fc8339a208">SegmentAddr</a> = 2,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or 80x86 processors, specifies the initial content of the CS:IP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// registers. The address field is 0000, the byte count is always 04,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the first two data bytes are the CS value, the latter two are the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// IP value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a6b5fcdbfab85c3e3f9c8428292bb1435"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a6b5fcdbfab85c3e3f9c8428292bb1435">StartAddr80x86</a> = 3,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Allows for 32 bit addressing (up to 4GiB). The record&#39;s address field</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is ignored (typically 0000) and its byte count is always 2 The two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// data bytes (big endian) specify the upper 16 bits of the 32 bit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// absolute address for all subsequent type 0 records</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35ae524d4984e373da1467ced1e805501a0"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35ae524d4984e373da1467ced1e805501a0">ExtendedAddr</a> = 4,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The address field is 0 (not used) and the byte count is always 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The four data bytes represent a 32-bit address value. In the case of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 80386 and higher CPUs, this address is loaded into the EIP register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a1ee44c2ba5272564456032e4cababee2"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a1ee44c2ba5272564456032e4cababee2">StartAddr</a> = 5,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We have no other valid types</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a51debf412714eae3effacf27c945e3ca"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/ihexrecord/#a0edef690b68eda42710473270d9a0f35a51debf412714eae3effacf27c945e3ca">InvalidType</a> = 6</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Base class for IHexSectionWriter. This class implements writing algorithm,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but doesn&#39;t actually write records. It is used for output buffer size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// calculation in IHexWriter::finalize.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> operator()(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase">SectionBase</a> &#42;Lhs, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase">SectionBase</a> &#42;Rhs)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// fix this we can use the lexicographic ordering on -&gt;Addr and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// original index.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Lhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a175b3cb20485be4d75ac2e380dd3dae8">OriginalOffset</a> == Rhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a175b3cb20485be4d75ac2e380dd3dae8">OriginalOffset</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Lhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a315d18f81b52ecc251615b3485bbb259">OriginalIndex</a> &lt; Rhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a315d18f81b52ecc251615b3485bbb259">OriginalIndex</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Lhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a175b3cb20485be4d75ac2e380dd3dae8">OriginalOffset</a> &lt; Rhs-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#a175b3cb20485be4d75ac2e380dd3dae8">OriginalOffset</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are two types of string tables that can exist, dynamic and not dynamic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the dynamic case the string table is allocated. Changing a dynamic string</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// table would mean altering virtual addresses and thus the memory image. So</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dynamic string tables should not have an interface to modify them or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reconstruct them. This type lets us reconstruct a string table. To avoid</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this class being used for dynamic string tables (which has happened) the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// classof method checks that the particular instance is not allocated. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then agrees with the makeSection method used to construct most sections.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/stringtablesection"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/stringtablesection/#a8a0dd563b85e11e1f4510bc970c8bfe2">StringTableSection</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#aa679879f673113d848d520be5db2cc2a">SectionBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a5574cded97b6d41af4b9b1460f282fe2">MAKE&#95;SEC&#95;WRITER&#95;FRIEND</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringtablebuilder">StringTableBuilder</a> StrTabBuilder;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00731" /><CodeLine lineNumber="731"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (S-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#aab7a7cefc3d8c0fac70539c18b84bfcd">OriginalFlags</a> &amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/elf/#a5def04786ab543821414e3d5f609e015a5da6bc7c194a345891a15fa856f0ec7c">ELF::SHF&#95;ALLOC</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00732" /><CodeLine lineNumber="732"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Symbols have a st&#95;shndx field that normally stores an index but occasionally</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocation/#a51f716f9908be1a269cdb1033ae1f774"><span class="doxyHighlight">  uint32&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocation/#a51f716f9908be1a269cdb1033ae1f774">Type</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All relocation sections denote relocations to apply to another section.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, some relocation sections use a dynamic symbol table and others use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a regular symbol table. Because the types of the two symbol tables differ in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// our system (because they should behave differently) we can&#39;t uniformly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// represent all relocations with the same base class if we expose an interface</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that mentions the symbol table type. So we split the two base types into two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// different classes, one which handles the section the relocation is applied to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and another which handles the symbol table type. The symbol table type is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// taken as a type parameter to the class (see RelocSectionWithSymtabBase).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocationsectionbase"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocationsectionbase">RelocationSectionBase</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#aa679879f673113d848d520be5db2cc2a">SectionBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocationsectionbase/#ab6fd94e8484dacd19eed5accacf577cc"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/sectionbase/#aa679879f673113d848d520be5db2cc2a">SectionBase</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/relocationsectionbase/#ab6fd94e8484dacd19eed5accacf577cc">SecToApplyRel</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It is often the case that the ELF header and the program header table are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// not present in any segment. This could be a problem during file layout,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// because other segments may get assigned an offset where either of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two should reside, which will effectively corrupt the resulting binary.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Other than that we use these segments to track program header offsets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when they may not follow the ELF header.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/object/#abca3a9e8e63b2753cc058efd14985867"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/segment">Segment</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/objcopy/elf/object/#abca3a9e8e63b2753cc058efd14985867">ElfHdrSegment</a>;</span></CodeLine>
